this is a cautionary tale because a very common way of creating these structures from the start is to build them up incrementally, take data one at a time form some data source and build them up.

It's also very common to store data in a sorted fashion so it's very possible that if you were to say to somebody, give me your data, I'll build you a binary search tree, and employ this algorithm, you would end up with a poorly behaved tree just because your friend happened to be helping you by giving you the data in order already sorted....does that make sense?
